ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They left early, intent on carrying out their scheme.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They left early in the morning bent on this purpose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They went forth early, believing that they had the power (to gather the fruit).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They were resolved to repel the beggars.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And they left at early morn, assuming they were in control of their purpose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they went in the morning with Hard Qadirin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And in the morning they went, having the power to prevent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And they went forth early, determined upon their purpose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They went betimes, strong in (this) purpose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They set out early in the morning, thinking they had the power to prevent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they went out betimes determined in purpose.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And they set out at early morning, [considering themselves] able to deprive [the poor of its fruit].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they went in the morning with strong intention, thinking that they have power (to prevent the poor taking anything of the fruits therefrom).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And they went out early, determined in their resolve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And early they went, resolved in intent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:25] And they went forth early, supposing themselves, able to prohibit, to prevent the poor folk [from enjoying the fruit].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: They went betimes) they went to their fields holding rancour, (strong in (this) purpose) to pluck their fruits.
